example.eg: The music in the bar was so loud that they couldn't hear each other talk.  I heard a loud noise.
example.egtrans: 酒吧音乐声音太大了，他们根本听不见对方在说什么。我听到了一声巨响。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大声的, 声音大的, 吵的

example.eg: It's very loud in here; can we go somewhere quieter?
example.egtrans: 这里太吵闹了，我们可以换个安静点的地方吗？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 嘈杂的, 声音响亮的

example.eg: Lots of people wear loud clothes when they go to the beach.
She was loud in her demands to see the shop manager.
She spoke loud to be heard over the music.
example.egtrans: 她大声说话，以免自己被音乐盖住。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大声地, 声音响亮地

dsense.name: for crying out loud
dsense.guideword: (exasperation) (表示不耐烦地、厌烦地、惊讶或者加强对某事要求的感叹)

example.eg: For crying out loud, how many times do I have to tell you to clean your room?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 岂有此理！真是的，够了！我的天啦！拜托！

example.eg: That joke made me laugh out loud!
I hear you loud and clear; we'll do the project your way.
The voters sent a loud and clear message in favor of reforms.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 清楚明白的, 一清二楚的
高谈阔论的，口无遮拦的

example.eg: Oh my gosh, did I say that out loud? I only meant to think it.
example.egtrans: 天呐，我刚刚大声说出来了么？我只是这样想想而已。
